src:
DPRD DKI Setuju Anggaran Renovasi Rumah Dinas Gubernur Rp 2,4 M
06 Nov 2019, 11:34 by Arief Ikhsanudin
Jakarta - Rencana anggaran rehabilitasi Rumah Dinas Gubernur DKI Jakarta disetujui Komisi D DPRD DKI Jakarta senilai Rp 2,422 miliar. Tidak ada perdebatan pembahasan rencana anggaran tersebut.
Ketua Komisi D, Ida Mahmudah mengetahui rencana anggaran ini sempat ramai dibahas publik. Dia sempat bertanya itu kepada Dinas Cipta Karya Tata Ruang dan Pertanahan (DCKTRP) yang merencanakan anggaran.
"Kemarin sempat rame nih. Tahun lalu juga sempat rame," ucap Ida dalam rapat rencana Kebijakan Umum Anggaran Prioritas Plafon Anggaran Sementara (KUA-PPAS), di Gedung DPRD, Jalan Kebon Sirih Jakarta Pusat, Selasa (6/11/2019).
Kepala DCKTRP Heru Hermawanto menyebut rencana itu sudah dianggarkan sejak lama. Namun, beberapa kali ditangguhkan.
"Kan nggak jadi (tahun lalu), ini sudah tiga kali penundaan. Perencanaan sudah jauh, pada saat dipegang oleh Dinas Perpemda (Perumahan dan Gedung Pemerintahan Daerah)," kata Heru.
text:
DKI DPRD Agree Budget for Home Office Governor Renovation of Rp. 2.4 Billion
Nov 6, 2019, 11:34 by Arief Ikhsanudin
Jakarta - The DKI Jakarta Governor's House Office's rehabilitation budget plan was approved by Commission D of DKI Jakarta DPRD worth Rp 2.422 billion. There is no debate over the budget plan.
Chairperson of Commission D, Ida Mahmudah knew that this budget plan was crowded with the public. He had asked that question to the Department of Spatial Planning and Land Management (DCKTRP) who planned the budget.
"Yesterday was crowded. Last year it was also crowded," Ida said in a meeting of the Provisional Budget Ceiling Priority Budget (KUA-PPAS) plan, at the DPRD Building, Jalan Kebon Sirih, Central Jakarta, Tuesday (11/06/2019).
DCKTRP head Heru Hermawanto said the plan had been budgeted for a long time. However, several times it was suspended.
"It did not happen (last year), it has already been delayed three times. Planning is far, when it is held by the Regional Administration Agency (Housing and Regional Government Buildings)," Heru said.
